channel.title: AI Unfiltered
channel.description: Chinese AI • Open Source • Security • Incidents. Signal, not noise.

item.title: Italy Fines Apple €98.6 Million Over ATT Rules Limiting App Store Competition
item.description: Apple has been fined €98.6 million ($116 million) by Italy's antitrust authority after finding that the company's App Tracking Transparency (ATT) privacy framework restricted App Store competition. The Italian Competition Authority (Autorità Garante della Concorrenza e del Mercato, or AGCM) said...

item.title: PhysMaster: Building an Autonomous AI Physicist for Theoretical and Computational Physics Research
item.description: arXiv:2512.19799v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Advances in LLMs have produced agents with knowledge and operational capabilities comparable to human scientists, suggesting potential to assist, accelerate, and automate research. However, existing studies mainly evaluate such systems on well-defined...

item.title: A Branch-and-Price Algorithm for Fast and Equitable Last-Mile Relief Aid Distribution
item.description: arXiv:2512.19882v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: The distribution of relief supplies to shelters is a critical aspect of post-disaster humanitarian logistics. In major disasters, prepositioned supplies often fall short of meeting all demands. We address the problem of planning vehicle routes from a...

item.title: Interpolative Decoding: Exploring the Spectrum of Personality Traits in LLMs
item.description: arXiv:2512.19937v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Recent research has explored using very large language models (LLMs) as proxies for humans in tasks such as simulation, surveys, and studies. While LLMs do not possess a human psychology, they often can emulate human behaviors with sufficiently high...

item.title: Zero-Shot Segmentation through Prototype-Guidance for Multi-Label Plant Species Identification
item.description: arXiv:2512.19957v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: This paper presents an approach developed to address the PlantClef 2025 challenge, which consists of a fine-grained multi-label species identification, over high-resolution images. Our solution focused on employing class prototypes obtained from the...

item.title: FGDCC: Fine-Grained Deep Cluster Categorization -- A Framework for Intra-Class Variability Problems in Plant Classification
item.description: arXiv:2512.19960v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Intra-class variability is given according to the significance in the degree of dissimilarity between images within a class. In that sense, depending on its intensity, intra-class variability can hinder the learning process for DL models, specially...

item.title: Large Language Models for EDA Cloud Job Resource and Lifetime Prediction
item.description: arXiv:2512.19701v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: The rapid growth of cloud computing in the Electronic Design Automation (EDA) industry has created a critical need for resource and job lifetime prediction to achieve optimal scheduling. Traditional machine learning methods often struggle with the...

item.title: Reducing Label Dependency in Human Activity Recognition with Wearables: From Supervised Learning to Novel Weakly Self-Supervised Approaches
item.description: arXiv:2512.19713v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Human activity recognition (HAR) using wearable sensors has advanced through various machine learning paradigms, each with inherent trade-offs between performance and labeling requirements. While fully supervised techniques achieve high accuracy, they...

item.title: Development and external validation of a multimodal artificial intelligence mortality prediction model of critically ill patients using multicenter data
item.description: arXiv:2512.19716v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Early prediction of in-hospital mortality in critically ill patients can aid clinicians in optimizing treatment. The objective was to develop a multimodal deep learning model, using structured and unstructured clinical data, to predict in-hospital...

item.title: Thermodynamic Focusing for Inference-Time Search: Practical Methods for Target-Conditioned Sampling and Prompted Inference
item.description: arXiv:2512.19717v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Finding rare but useful solutions in very large candidate spaces is a recurring practical challenge across language generation, planning, and reinforcement learning. We present a practical framework, \emph{Inverted Causality Focusing Algorithm}...

item.title: Synthetic Data Blueprint (SDB): A modular framework for the statistical, structural, and graph-based evaluation of synthetic tabular data
item.description: arXiv:2512.19718v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: In the rapidly evolving era of Artificial Intelligence (AI), synthetic data are widely used to accelerate innovation while preserving privacy and enabling broader data accessibility. However, the evaluation of synthetic data remains fragmented across...

item.title: HARMON-E: Hierarchical Agentic Reasoning for Multimodal Oncology Notes to Extract Structured Data
item.description: arXiv:2512.19864v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Unstructured notes within the electronic health record (EHR) contain rich clinical information vital for cancer treatment decision making and research, yet reliably extracting structured oncology data remains challenging due to extensive variability,...

item.title: How well do Large Language Models Recognize Instructional Moves? Establishing Baselines for Foundation Models in Educational Discourse
item.description: arXiv:2512.19903v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Large language models (LLMs) are increasingly adopted in educational technologies for a variety of tasks, from generating instructional materials and assisting with assessment design to tutoring. While prior work has investigated how models can be...

item.title: Counterfactual LLM-based Framework for Measuring Rhetorical Style
item.description: arXiv:2512.19908v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: The rise of AI has fueled growing concerns about ``hype'' in machine learning papers, yet a reliable way to quantify rhetorical style independently of substantive content has remained elusive. Because bold language can stem from either strong...

item.title: PRISM: A Personality-Driven Multi-Agent Framework for Social Media Simulation
item.description: arXiv:2512.19933v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Traditional agent-based models (ABMs) of opinion dynamics often fail to capture the psychological heterogeneity driving online polarization due to simplistic homogeneity assumptions. This limitation obscures the critical interplay between individual...

item.title: Bias Beneath the Tone: Empirical Characterisation of Tone Bias in LLM-Driven UX Systems
item.description: arXiv:2512.19950v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Large Language Models are increasingly used in conversational systems such as digital personal assistants, shaping how people interact with technology through language. While their responses often sound fluent and natural, they can also carry subtle...

item.title: Baidu’s ERNIE 5.0 Preview Tops LMSYS Arena, Surpassing GPT-5.2
item.description: Baidu’s ERNIE 5.0 Preview-1203 tops the LMSYS Arena text leaderboard with 1,451 points, becoming the first Chinese model to lead globally and outperforming GPT-5.2 in creative and complex tasks.

item.title: Baidu’s Radish Run Announces 2026 Entry into London Unmanned Driving Market
item.description: Baidu’s Radish Run partners with Uber to launch unmanned ride-hailing services in London in 2026, marking its first right-hand-drive market expansion beyond Hong Kong.

item.title: Ant Group’s “MaYi A Fu” AI Health App Goes Viral, Accelerating AI Healthcare Commercialization
item.description: Ant Group’s “MaYi A Fu” AI health app surges to over 15 million MAU, driving AI healthcare commercialization and boosting related stocks, as the sector accelerates with full hospital deployments and upcoming AI drug discovery IPOs.

item.title: Sazhi Intelligence Raises Hundreds of Millions RMB in Funding
item.description: Sazhi Intelligence secures hundreds of millions RMB in A++ and A+++ rounds led by Haitong Kaiyuan and Guoyuan Equity to accelerate R&D and global expansion of its embodied intelligence robots for flexible manufacturing.

item.title: Google's year in review: 8 areas with research breakthroughs in 2025
item.description: Google 2025 recap: Research breakthroughs of the year

item.title: Researchers are getting organoids pregnant with human embryos
item.description: At first glance, it looks like the start of a human pregnancy: A ball-shaped embryo presses gently into the receptive lining of the uterus and then grips tight, burrowing in as the first tendrils of a future placenta appear.  This is implantation—the moment that pregnancy officially begins....

item.title: Two Chrome Extensions Caught Secretly Stealing Credentials from Over 170 Sites
item.description: Cybersecurity researchers have discovered two malicious Google Chrome extensions with the same name and published by the same developer that come with capabilities to intercept traffic and capture user credentials. The extensions are advertised as a "multi-location network speed test plug-in" for...

item.title: ServiceNow to Acquire Armis for $7.75 Billion in Cash
item.description: Rumors of a possible buyout surfaced earlier this month, with the official announcement coming just weeks after Armis announced raising $435 million. The post ServiceNow to Acquire Armis for $7.75 Billion in Cash appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: AprielGuard: A Guardrail for Safety and Adversarial Robustness in Modern LLM Systems
SemanticGen: Video Generation in Semantic Space
item.description: State-of-the-art video generative models typically learn the distribution of video latents in the VAE space and map them to pixels using a VAE decoder. While this approach can generate high-quality videos, it suffers from slow convergence and is computationally expensive when generating long...

item.title: Active Intelligence in Video Avatars via Closed-loop World Modeling
item.description: Current video avatar generation methods excel at identity preservation and motion alignment but lack genuine agency, they cannot autonomously pursue long-term goals through adaptive environmental interaction. We address this by introducing L-IVA (Long-horizon Interactive Visual Avatar), a task and...

item.title: Nissan Confirms Impact From Red Hat Data Breach
item.description: The personal information of 21,000 customers was stolen after hackers compromised Red Hat’s GitLab instances. The post Nissan Confirms Impact From Red Hat Data Breach appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: Feds Seize Password Database Used in Massive Bank Account Takeover Scheme
item.description: The cybercriminals attempted to steal $28 million from compromised bank accounts through phishing. The post Feds Seize Password Database Used in Massive Bank Account Takeover Scheme appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: INTERPOL Arrests 574 in Africa; Ukrainian Ransomware Affiliate Pleads Guilty
item.description: A law enforcement operation coordinated by INTERPOL has led to the recovery of $3 million and the arrest of 574 suspects by authorities from 19 countries, amidst a continued crackdown on cybercrime networks in Africa. The coordinated effort, named Operation Sentinel, took place between October 27...

item.title: Passwd: A walkthrough of the Google Workspace Password Manager
item.description: Passwd is designed specifically for organizations operating within Google Workspace. Rather than competing as a general consumer password manager, its purpose is narrow, and business-focused: secure credential storage, controlled sharing, and seamless Workspace integration. The platform emphasizes...

item.title: NPM Package With 56,000 Downloads Steals WhatsApp Credentials, Data
item.description: The package provides legitimate functionality to evade detection, while stealing users’ data and deploying a backdoor. The post NPM Package With 56,000 Downloads Steals WhatsApp Credentials, Data appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: Elevated error rates on Opus 4.5
item.description: Dec 23, 10:51 UTCResolved - This incident has been resolved.Dec 23, 09:55 UTCInvestigating - We are currently investigating this issue.

item.title: Incident with Issues and Pull Requests

A detailed root cause analysis will be shared as soon as it is available.Dec 23, 10:32 UTCUpdate - Issues and Pull Requests are operating normally.Dec 23, 10:29...

item.title: Italy Antitrust Agency Fines Apple $116 Million Over Privacy Feature; Apple Announces Appeal
item.description: Italy’s antitrust authority fined Apple $116 million after determining that operating one of its privacy features restricted App Store competition. The post Italy Antitrust Agency Fines Apple $116 Million Over Privacy Feature; Apple Announces Appeal appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: How social media encourages the worst of AI boosterism
item.description: Demis Hassabis, CEO of Google DeepMind, summed it up in three words: “This is embarrassing.”   Hassabis was replying on X to an overexcited post by Sébastien Bubeck, a research scientist at the rival firm OpenAI, announcing that two mathematicians had used OpenAI’s latest large language...

item.title: How I learned to stop worrying and love AI slop
item.description: Lately, everywhere I scroll, I keep seeing the same fish-eyed CCTV view: a grainy wide shot from the corner of a living room, a driveway at night, an empty grocery store. Then something impossible happens. JD Vance shows up at the doorstep in a crazy outfit. A car folds into itself like paper and...

item.title: Multi-LLM Thematic Analysis with Dual Reliability Metrics: Combining Cohen's Kappa and Semantic Similarity for Qualitative Research Validation
item.description: Qualitative research faces a critical reliability challenge: traditional inter-rater agreement methods require multiple human coders, are time-intensive, and often yield moderate consistency. We present a multi-perspective validation framework for LLM-based thematic analysis that combines ensemble...

item.title: DingTalk Launches Agent OS, the World’s First AI-Native Operating System for Work
item.description: DingTalk has unveiled Agent OS, positioning it as the world’s first AI-native operating system built specifically for intelligent work collaboration.

item.title: U.S. DoJ Seizes Fraud Domain Behind $14.6 Million Bank Account Takeover Scheme
item.description: The U.S. Justice Department (DoJ) on Monday announced the seizure of a web domain and database that it said was used to further a criminal scheme designed to target and defraud Americans by means of bank account takeover fraud. The domain in question, web3adspanels[.]org, was used as a backend web...

item.title: FaithLens: Detecting and Explaining Faithfulness Hallucination
item.description: Recognizing whether outputs from large language models (LLMs) contain faithfulness hallucination is crucial for real-world applications, e.g., retrieval-augmented generation and summarization. In this paper, we introduce FaithLens, a cost-efficient and effective faithfulness hallucination detection...

item.title: Disruption with some GitHub services
item.description: Dec 23, 00:17 UTCResolved - This incident has been resolved. Thank you for your patience and understanding as we addressed this issue. A detailed root cause analysis will be shared as soon as it is available.Dec 23, 00:06 UTCUpdate - All services at healthy levels. We're finalizing the change to...

item.title: The Prism Hypothesis: Harmonizing Semantic and Pixel Representations via Unified Autoencoding
item.description: Deep representations across modalities are inherently intertwined. In this paper, we systematically analyze the spectral characteristics of various semantic and pixel encoders. Interestingly, our study uncovers a highly inspiring and rarely explored correspondence between an encoder's feature...

item.title: Welcome to Kenya’s Great Carbon Valley: a bold new gamble to fight climate change
item.description: The earth around Lake Naivasha, a shallow freshwater basin in south-central Kenya, does not seem to want to lie still.  Ash from nearby Mount Longonot, which erupted as recently as the 1860s, remains in the ground. Obsidian caves and jagged stone towers preside over the steam that spurts out...

item.title: This company is developing gene therapies for muscle growth, erectile dysfunction, and “radical longevity”
item.description: At some point next month, a handful of volunteers will be injected with two experimental gene therapies as part of an unusual clinical trial. The drugs are potential longevity therapies, says Ivan Morgunov, the CEO of Unlimited Bio, the company behind the trial. His long-term goal: to achieve...

item.title: Elevated error rates on Opus 4.5
item.description: Dec 22, 07:18 UTCInvestigating - We are currently investigating this issue.

item.title: Elevated number of 5xx errors in BOM
item.description: Dec 22, 06:16 UTCResolved - Between 06:16-06:33 UTC, customers reaching Mumbai, IN, may have experienced an elevated number of 5xx errors and increased latency due to congestion.
